venue.name: Blackstone River Valley Bikeway @ The Blackstone River State Park

item.description:
If it is raining – I will reschedule for another day.

PLEASE TAKE THE POLL TO LET US KNOW WHAT YOU ARE GOING TO DO...
WALK, JOG, RUN, BIKE or ROLL. Click the link below to vote
http://www.meetup.com...

My meetups are just for fun and pleasure.
Anyone and everyone is welcome.
So don't get stressed about having to complete the whole path, just come on out, enjoy the outdoors and meet some new folks.

The Blackstone River Bikeway is 10 miles of paved bike path from Lincoln through Valley Falls Heritage Park in Cumberland and ends in Woonsocket at the Water Treatment Plant on Manville Hill Road.
Located along the bikeway in Lincoln,
Wilbur Kelly House - The Kelly House Museum, focuses on transportation history.
In Ashton, RI, the Bikeway follows the route of the Blackstone Canal for three miles, mostly on top of the historic towpath. While at Ashton, visit the Captain Wilbur Kelly House Museum, a newly opened museum and visitor center adjacent to the Bikeway that offers free tours. The Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management manages the Rhode Island segments which have already become a popular recreation destination.
The path stretches north to Woonsocket, RI, home of the Museum of Work and Culture.

Go at your own pace
Go as far as you want
Stop where ever you want
Stay for as long as you want & leave whenever you want.
NO STRESS!!!

Meet us at The Blackstone River State Park, Front Street, Lincoln

* From Route 95 North Take Exit 23, Route 146 North to Breakneck Hill Road, Route 123, continue eastbound, becomes Front Street, bike path parking area located on your left at flashing yellow light.
* From Route 95 South Take Exit 4 for Route 295 South to Exit9A For Route 146 South to Breakneck Hill Road, Route 123, continue eastbound on Route 123 becomes Front St., bike path parking area located on your left at flashing yellow light.

I drive a white Toyota Highland meet me by my car. We won't leave until 10 AM
If it is raining – I will reschedule for another day.

FYI... The Blackstone River Bikeway scenic bike-path will eventually link to the popular East Bay Bike Path, making a continuous 31 mile route for alternative transportation. This section should be completed by Summer 2009.

FYI... Eventually, The Blackstone River Bikeway will ultimately extend 48 miles from Providence, RI to Worcester, MA. Currently, 10 miles of bike path are open to the public in Central Falls, Lincoln, & Cumberland, RI. An additional 2.5 miles of bikeway is complete from Millbury to Worcester. Currently there are 25 miles under construction to connect Woonsocket to Millbury.
item.how_to_find_us: I have a White Toyota SVU. I will have a Red Towel unfold over the hood
item.name: Blackstone River Bike Path - 10 Miles Long - 20 Miles Total Trip Back & Forth
